Equations Module

class phrike.equations.EulerEquations1D(gamma: float = 1.4)[source]

Bases: object

Compressible Euler equations in 1D, conservative form.

This class implements the 1D compressible Euler equations:

\[\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial (\rho u)}{\partial x} = 0 \frac{\partial (\rho u)}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial (\rho u^2 + p)}{\partial x} = 0 \frac{\partial E}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial ((E + p)u)}{\partial x} = 0\]

where \(E = \frac{p}{\gamma-1} + \frac{1}{2}\rho u^2\) is the total energy density.

State vector U = [rho, mom, E], where:

  • rho: density

  • mom: momentum density (rho * u)

  • E: total energy density = p/(gamma-1) + 0.5*rho*u^2

Parameters:

gamma – Adiabatic index (default: 1.4)

gamma: float = 1.4
primitive(U: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray][source]

Convert conservative variables to primitive variables.

Parameters:

U – Conservative variables array of shape (3, N)

Returns:

  • rho: density array

  • u: velocity array

  • p: pressure array

  • a: sound speed array

Return type:

Tuple of (rho, u, p, a) where

conservative(rho: ndarray, u: ndarray, p: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Convert primitive variables to conservative variables.

Parameters:

  • rho – Density array

  • u – Velocity array

  • p – Pressure array

Returns:

  • U[0] = rho (density)

  • U[1] = rho * u (momentum density)

  • U[2] = E (total energy density)

Return type:

Conservative variables array of shape (3, N) where

Grid Module

class phrike.grid.Grid1D(N: int, Lx: float, dealias: bool = True, filter_params: Dict[str, float] | None = None, fft_workers: int = 1, backend: str = 'numpy', torch_device: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Uniform periodic 1D grid and spectral operators.

N

Number of spatial points.

Type:

int

Lx

Domain length.

Type:

float

dealias

If True, apply 2/3-rule dealiasing mask in spectral space.

Type:

bool

filter_params

Optional exponential filter configuration with keys: - enabled: bool - p: even integer (>= 2) - alpha: filter strength

Type:

Optional[Dict[str, float]]

N: int
Lx: float
dealias: bool = True
filter_params: Dict[str, float] | None = None
fft_workers: int = 1
backend: str = 'numpy'
torch_device: str | None = None
rfft(f: ndarray) → ndarray[source]
irfft(F: ndarray) → ndarray[source]
dx1(f: ndarray) → ndarray[source]
apply_spectral_filter(f: ndarray) → ndarray[source]
convolve(f: ndarray, g: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Compute product in physical space, with dealiased spectral filtering.

For pseudo-spectral nonlinearity, compute pointwise product then apply dealiasing/filter on the spectral representation.

__init__(N: int, Lx: float, dealias: bool = True, filter_params: Dict[str, float] | None = None, fft_workers: int = 1, backend: str = 'numpy', torch_device: str | None = None) → None

Problems Module

Problem registry and base classes for SpectralHydro simulations.

class phrike.problems.BaseProblem(config_path: str | None = None, config: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, restart_from: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: ABC

Base class for all Hydra problems.

__init__(config_path: str | None = None, config: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, restart_from: str | None = None)[source]

Initialize problem with configuration.

Parameters:

  • config_path – Path to YAML configuration file

  • config – Configuration dictionary (takes precedence over config_path)

  • restart_from – Path to checkpoint file for restart

static clear_numba_cache()[source]

Clear numba cache to prevent module name conflicts.

This is primarily useful as a one-time fix after package renames. Use the –clear-cache CLI flag when needed.

compute_conservation_errors(solver, U)[source]

Compute conservation errors relative to initial values.

Register a problem class.

Parameters:

  • problem_class – Problem class that inherits from BaseProblem

IO Module

phrike.io.load_config(path: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]
phrike.io.ensure_outdir(outdir: str) → None[source]
phrike.io.load_checkpoint(checkpoint_path: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Load a checkpoint file and return the simulation state.

Parameters:

checkpoint_path – Path to the checkpoint file (.npz)

Returns:

  • t: simulation time

  • U: conservative variables

  • grid_params: grid parameters (N, Lx, etc.)

  • physics_params: physics parameters (gamma, etc.)

  • primitive_vars: primitive variables (rho, u, p, etc.)

Return type:

Dictionary containing
